Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 08:49AM TracieM wrote: Wanted to say thank you for all the well wishes...they worked, it was an 11 hour surgery, went well can't believe how great it looks. Sooo much better then it did with TE. PS was a god send...after care is great, pain managed well and very proactive Thanks again Trace

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2011 01:09PM TracieM wrote: Hoping to go home today...I REALLY want to go home so I can sleep. They have had me up for something every two hours. On Antibiotic, blood thinner, off pump pain meds by mouth and anti inflammatory. Still feeling pretty with the outcome. Just keep holding my breathe...so afraid something else will happen. Some swelling on DIEP side, not much on other side. Thanks again for all the kind words and best wishes those with up coming surgeries Tracie

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2011 01:13AM TracieM wrote: Well things seemed to good to be true...while the surgery sites look great, it seems my white cell count is up to 26000 and know one knows why...I don't have a spleen (Hodgkins 25 years ago)...anyone have any thoughts? Levels have been 19k 22k now 26k...running low grade fever 98.8 to 100.3...not sure how worried I should be Tracie
Posts.Title: Any October 2011 Surgeries out there want to wait together? gamergirl GrandmaV

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 11:20PM TracieM wrote: Hang in there Suvivor 11 , that happened to me as well...kept taking more skin, then one day just ripped it out..cleaned it up...i was wide awake. The BS and PS said cultures clean, no infection...then Onc saw it said it was infected...sent me to infectious disese doc. I had a nasty infection...my husband spent 2 months packing the big hole. It's been 9 months...and tomorrow I am scheduled for a DIEP with a new PS...please go see an infection doc...they kept telling me I was depressed and it was the radiated skin....3 days after starting Cipro...felt like myself again
Posts.Title: Any October 2011 Surgeries out there want to wait together? gamergirl GrandmaV

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2011 11:49PM TracieM wrote: Hi ladies, I am scheduled for DIEP recon on this Weds. The 5th. My mastectomy was Dec 2010, at that point they treid an alloderm tissue expander. Did not work at all, with infection, previous radiation (Hodgkins 25 years ago) and a diabetes diagnosis the same month the entire process was a mess. So nice to have the expander pulled out and a large whole left. Finished chemo in April, changed PS, hopefully this time I will have better luck. Have heard good things about DIEP as I have now found out probably should not have even attempted the expanders, at that point that was the only option offered, they discussed was aTram Flap and that sounded so scary...kinda feel like it was a bait and switch..all an all doing ok, just looking forward to getting it all finished and getting back to a so called "normal" life...is that even possible...good luck to all of you having surgeries. Tracie
